title: Issue with riot connection routing *IMPORTANT*
body:
I have been having an issue lately with my connection to the game servers. I live in northern Ohio, and get around 65-70ms, which is an obvious problem. My initial thought was that I had something on my computer that was affecting my connection. However, after asking around and some calls to my ISP, I was made aware that it was issue that was native to my local area. I asked my ISP what the fix would be for this issue, and they informed me that there is little they can do considering that my connection to the hop prior to riot game servers was around 15ms. I ran a trace route in hopes to find the issue:

Tracing route to 104.160.131.1 over a maximum of 30 hops

  1     1 ms    <1 ms    <1 ms  192.168.0.1
  2    16 ms    19 ms     8 ms  10.24.0.1
  3    16 ms    17 ms    10 ms  72.240.7.61
  4    18 ms    18 ms     9 ms  72.240.111.29
  5    10 ms    12 ms     6 ms  72.240.111.49
  6    22 ms    24 ms    16 ms  xe-10-3-2.bar2.Detroit1.Level3.net [4.53.74.101]
  7    20 ms    15 ms    13 ms  ae-2-3603.ear3.Chicago2.Level3.net [4.69.159.186]
  8    52 ms    59 ms    55 ms  104.160.131.1

Trace complete.

As you can see the hop that is posing the issue is between 7-8. This has been a problem for around ~6 months, and is quite annoying. I have made calls to my ISP and Level3 (The people routing my connection) and they all have said this would be an issue that Riot Games would need to resolve. This is an issue with everyone is our area, so I would hope that this issue would be of utmost importance. 
Thanks in advance. (I hope)

_**Additional Information**_: My ISP is Buckeye Cable System, and the people who route the connection are Level3 Communications.

_**PS:**_ For full disclosure, I ran another Trace Route to the alternate Riot IP:

Tracing route to 104.160.131.3 over a maximum of 30 hops

  1     1 ms    <1 ms    <1 ms  192.168.0.1
  2    12 ms    12 ms     7 ms  10.24.0.1
  3    21 ms    17 ms    13 ms  72.240.7.61
  4    24 ms    19 ms    13 ms  72.240.111.29
  5    12 ms    11 ms    12 ms  72.240.111.49
  6    48 ms     *       24 ms  xe-10-3-2.bar2.Detroit1.Level3.net [4.53.74.101]
  7    17 ms    17 ms    18 ms  ae-2-3603.ear3.Chicago2.Level3.net [4.69.159.186]
  8    49 ms    56 ms    49 ms  4.15.84.86
  9    50 ms    53 ms    47 ms  104.160.131.3

Trace complete.

replies.body:
Your traceroutes here show a little bit of info, but there's a lot of context missing here. I'd like you to run another traceroute, this time using [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/) to complete the task. After loading up the app, you can paste **104.160.131.1** into the host field and start the trace. After 5 minutes has gone by, export your results as text and paste them in a reply.

Let me know if you run into any issues.

Bear in mind that I live in NORTHERN Ohio. I have spoken with my ISP and they have told me that not only have they been waiting for a response from Riot for well over a month, but other ISP and network backbones (AT&T, Comcast, Level 3) have all reported the same issue when routing to Riot specifically! I have been assured that this almost certainly an issue on Riots end. 

Please find someone to invest some time to find a real solution and not just deflect the blame.
Thanks in advance!

|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|                                      WinMTR statistics                                   |
|                       Host              -   %  | Sent | Recv | Best | Avrg | Wrst | Last |
|------------------------------------------------|------|------|------|------|------|------|
|                             192.168.0.1 -    0 |  202 |  202 |    4 |    8 |   15 |    8 |
|                               10.24.0.1 -    0 |  202 |  202 |    6 |    8 |   17 |   10 |
|                             72.240.7.61 -    0 |  202 |  202 |    9 |   12 |   20 |   13 |
|                           72.240.111.29 -    0 |  202 |  202 |    8 |   12 |   20 |    9 |
|                           72.240.111.49 -    0 |  202 |  202 |    6 |    9 |   19 |    9 |
|      xe-10-3-2.bar2.Detroit1.Level3.net -    0 |  202 |  202 |   14 |   16 |   39 |   17 |
|      ae-2-3603.ear3.Chicago2.Level3.net -   26 |   91 |   68 |   13 |  542 | 4846 |   14 |
|                           104.160.131.1 -    0 |  202 |  202 |   43 |   46 |   56 |   43 |
|________________________________________________|______|______|______|______|______|______|
   WinMTR v0.92 GPL V2 by Appnor MSP - Fully Managed Hosting & Cloud Provider

Your traceroute shows that your routing issue happens at the **ae-2-3603.ear3.Chicago2.Level3.net** network hop where your connection experiences 26% packet loss and a latency spike of **4846ms**. Because this is happening on a Level3 node, you'll want to reach out to your ISP's tier 2 support with this traceroute so they can work with Level3 to resolve this.

If you have any other questions, feel free to hit me back up.
Do you think that It would be possible for Riot to somehow get into contact with Level3 about"ae-2-3603.ear3.Chicago2.Level3.net", considering that this issue is affecting a large portion of North?

We cannot contact Level3 or your ISP on your behalf, but if Level3 has already reached out to our network engineers, it wouldn't necessarily be a bad thing to have communications coming from both ends. It could even potentially be a quicker path to a permanent solution for this.

Hit me up again if you have any other concerns. ^.^

It looks like in your specific instance, your issue is caused by the consistent 20% packet loss across your entire route and the consistent latency (ping) spikes of 319+ms along your entire route as well. Reaching out to your ISP's tier 2 support with this traceroute would be the best course of action.

I hope this helped!

yup! same problem in michigan.

  1    <1 ms    <1 ms    <1 ms  RT-AC56U-1B50 [192.168.1.1]
  2    10 ms     9 ms    10 ms  96.120.40.5
  3    11 ms    10 ms    10 ms  68.86.121.57
  4    18 ms    18 ms    19 ms  xe-0-0-2-0-sur02.stclairshors.mi.michigan.comcast.net [68.85.222.141]
  5    38 ms    41 ms    33 ms  be-33668-cr02.ashburn.va.ibone.comcast.net [68.86.90.13]
  6    30 ms    29 ms    30 ms  hu-0-11-0-2-pe07.ashburn.va.ibone.comcast.net [68.86.83.2]
  7    36 ms    36 ms    90 ms  e0-0.cr01.atl01.mzima.net [75.149.228.166]
  8    46 ms    39 ms    32 ms  104.160.137.35
  9    32 ms    32 ms    32 ms  ae35-br01.chi01.riotdirect.net [104.160.159.26] 
 10    32 ms    32 ms    32 ms  104.160.131.1

It be nice if someone could actually provide some feed back on how or what is gonna get done to fix this. There are a lot of ppl having problems it seems with this same issue, in the same area. My own post has been up for 6 days and i got no response after pasting my MTR info 3 days ago, iv been stuck in bot games constantly testing my MS to see if anything changes and its just constantly bad 90-130+  when it should be 23-40, i just want some answers im getting tired of spending 1/4 of the my time in a  match standing still/running into towers waiting for the connection =/
